intro: Bupleurum candollei var. paucefulcrans, commonly known as the slender root bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound umbels. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing a slender, branched stem. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. This variety is notable for its medicinal potential, though it remains relatively understudied in modern pharmacology.
